edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final

Class GameEngine

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cpp.cs.cs141.prog_final.GameEngine
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public class GameEngine
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    This class contains all the logic for the game, including collision with room, Ninjas killing the player, shooting the gun, looking, win conditions, etc.
    Author:
    Corey Perez, Eduardo Saenz, Lance Dall, Grant Posner, Bumjoong Kim, Jacob Chong
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      • GameEngine

        public GameEngine()
        Constructor for the GameEngine(). Initializes the Player() with their gun, all the PowerUps() and GameBoard().

      • shootGun

        public void shootGun(java.lang.String dir)
        Shoots a gun in a direction, checking each cell in the row or column the #player() specifies, killing a Ninja() if there is one. This also subtracts the amount of ammo the player's Gun() has by 1
        Parameters:
        dir -

      • roomCollisionPlayer

        public boolean roomCollisionPlayer(java.lang.String dir)
        Checks whether or not the Player() can move in a direction. Collision is true when the player is about to collide into a #Rooms().
        Parameters:
        dir -

      • roomCollisionNinja

                                  java.lang.String dir)
        Returns true if the direction the Ninja() is moving is a Rooms()
        Parameters:
        counter: - the counter of the ninja being checked for collision
        dir -

      • gameOver

        public boolean gameOver()
        Sets the gameOver status to true or false

      • checkForGameOver

        public void checkForGameOver()
        Checks the gameOver status to see if the game is over. The game is over if the player's lives reach 0, or the Briefcase() is found

      • winCondition

        public boolean winCondition()
        Returns whether the player wins or not

      • playerLook

        public void playerLook(java.lang.String dir)
        Lets the player look in a specific direction and prints whether a Ninja() is in a direction
        Parameters:

      • getLooking

        public boolean getLooking()
        returns whether the player is looking or not
        Returns:

      • setLooking

        public void setLooking(boolean x)
        Sets the player to looking or not looking
        Parameters:
        x -

      • resetGrid

        public void resetGrid()
        Resets the grid. This is done every time time player dies

      • checkForSpy

        public void checkForSpy()
        Done for every Ninja() for every turn. Checks whether or not the player is on a space next to the ninja. Kills the player if that's the case

      • stabSpy

        public void stabSpy()
        Checks if the player is invincible. If they aren't they lose a life and respawn.

      • checkRoom

        public void checkRoom()
        Checks the room that the player is above. If the room contains the Briefcase(), the player wins.

      • isBulletAvailable

        public boolean isBulletAvailable()
        Checks if the player has the Bullet() powerup

      • isRadarAvailable

        public boolean isRadarAvailable()
        Checks if the player has the Radar() powerup

      • isInvincibilityAvailable

        public boolean isInvincibilityAvailable()
        Checks if the player has the Invincibility() powerup

      • pickUpPowerUp

        public void pickUpPowerUp()
        Picks up PowerUps() if the player steps on top of them

      • checkInvincible

        public void checkInvincible()
        Checks if the player's turn counter is above 5 to see if they've lost their invincibility.
